wattadvisor.utils.results_composition

Attributes

logger

Functions

write_detailed_results(pyomo_model, components_list, ...)

Creates a DataFrame with all optimization time series data and writes it to a excel file.

generate_results_object(...)

Creates the complete OptimizationResultsModel which is returned as the response of the WattAdvisor.

Module Contents

wattadvisor.utils.results_composition.logger
wattadvisor.utils.results_composition.write_detailed_results(pyomo_model: pyomo.core.base.PyomoModel.Model, components_list: List[wattadvisor.components.component.Component], calculation_time: float, filename: pathlib.Path | None = None)

Creates a DataFrame with all optimization time series data and writes it to a excel file.

Parameters:

  • pyomo_model (Model) – Pyomo optimization model containing all parameters, variables and constraints aswell as the objective function.

  • components_list (List[Component]) – List of all optimization components added to the optimiziation model

  • calculation_time (float) – Time in seconds it took for the solver to solve the optimization model

  • filename (Path or None) – name of the Excel file to export, by default None

wattadvisor.utils.results_composition.generate_results_object(opt_model_object: wattadvisor.opt_model.OptModel, components_list: List[wattadvisor.components.component.Component], status: wattadvisor.data_models.enums.OptimizationStatus, use_solver: wattadvisor.data_models.enums.SupportedSolver, solver_executable: str | None = None) → wattadvisor.data_models.optimization_results_model.OptimizationResults

Creates the complete OptimizationResultsModel which is returned as the response of the WattAdvisor.

Returns:

Object which contains all optimization results (cost, produced energy, power) for the WattAdvisor response

Return type:

OptimizationResultsModel

Parameters:

  • opt_model_object (OptModel) – Object of the optimization model

  • components_list (List[Component]) – List of all optimization components added to the optimiziation model

  • status (OptimizationStatus) – Status of the completed optimization

  • use_solver (SupportedSolver) – Solver to be used for the optimization for the current scenario

  • solver_executable (str | None, optional) – Path of the solver’s executable, by default None

Returns:

Object that contains all relevant results of current and target scenario optimization

Return type:

OptimizationResults
